    projects

    Paletta - Open-Source Oil Painting Simulation

    Published: January 01, 2014

    Paletta is digital painting software that simulates oil painting via a proprietary color mixing algorithm.

    Website https://blaisetine.github.io/paletta

    CocoGL - Open-Source 3D Graphics Emulator for OpenGL-ES

    Published: January 01, 2015

    CocoGL is an OpenGL ES 1.0/1.1 3D graphics software emulator for Windows and Linux.

    Website https://gtcasl.github.io/cocogl/

    Flexgraph - A Reconfigurable Hybrid CPU-FPGA Graph Analytics Accelerator

    Published: January 01, 2017

    Flexgraph is a reconfigurable domain-specific accelerator for graph analytics targeting heteregenous CPU-FPGA platforms.

    Website https://github.com/gtcasl/flexgraph

    CASH - Domain-Specific Language for Hardware Design

    Published: January 01, 2018

    Cash is a C++ embedded domain specific library (EDSL) for hardware design and simulation.

    Website https://gtcasl.github.io/cash/

    Vortex - Open-Source GPU Framework

    Published: January 01, 2021

    Vortex is an open-source full-system GPU framework.

    Website https://github.com/vortexgpgpu

    Authors: Blaise-Pascal Tine, Sudhakar Yalamanchili

    Published in Proceedings of the International Symposium on Memory Systems, 2017

    Recommended citation: Blaise-Pascal Tine and Sudhakar Yalamanchili. 2017. Pagevault: securing off-chip memory using page-based authentication. In Proceedings of the International Symposium on Memory Systems (MEMSYS '17). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 293–304. https://doi.org/10.1145/3132402.3132439

    Published in International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays, 2020

    Recommended citation: Blaise Tine, Seyong Lee, Jeffrey S. Vetter, Hyesoon Kim. Productive Hardware Designs using Hybrid HLS-RTL Development. In Proceedings of the International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Arrays

    Tango: an optimizing compiler for Just-In-Time RTL simulation

    Published in 2020 Design, Automation & Test in Europe Conference & Exhibition (DATE), 2020

    Recommended citation: Blaise Tine, Sudhakar Yalamanchili, and Hyesoon Kim, 'Tango: An Optimizing Compiler for Just-In-Time RTL Simulation,' in 2020 Design, Automation & Test in Europe Conference & Exhiition (DATE), 2020, pp. 157-162, doi: 10.23919/DATE48585.2020.9116253.

    Accelerating Graphic Rendering on Programmable RISC-V GPUs

    Authors: Blaise Tine, Varun Saxena, Santosh Srivatsan, Joshua R. Simpson, Fadi Alzammar, Liam Paul Cooper, Sam Jijina, Swetha Rajagoplan, Tejaswini Anand Kumar, Jeff Young, Hyesoon Kim

Simpson, Fadi Alzammar, Liam Paul Cooper, Sam Jijina, Swetha Rajagoplan, Tejaswini Anand Kumar, Jeff Young, Hyesoon Kim. Accelerating Graphic Rendering on Programmable RISC-V GPUs. In Proceedings of the 2022 IEEE Hot Chips 34 Symposium (HCS)

    Vortex: A Reconfigurable RISC-V GPGPU Accelerator for Architecture Research

    talks

    Software Development for the Mobile Area

    Published: January 10, 2010

    Talked to hundredth of young Cameroonian students at the university of Douala about my work experience as a software developer and the opportunities that are present for the next generation of Africans entering the mobile area.

    teaching

    ECE8823 - GPU Architectures

    Graduate course, Georgia Institute of Technology, 2018

    As lead teaching assistant with several guest lectures. The courses covers the basic principles of parallel programming using CUDA and OpenCL, and introduces students to advanced microarchitecture concepts unique to single-instruction-multiple-threads (SIMT) processors.

    CS3220 - Processor Design

    Intermediate-level Course, Georgia Institute of Technology, 2022

    Main instructor. It is project-driven course teaching the principles of hardware design tailored towards modern CPU and GPU implementations. The course also introduces students to the RISC-V ISA and FPGAs development, with practical lab experiments to learn about Verilog RTL design and high-level synthesis.
